title: RBI Grade B - FM - FLM4 - Objective

quiz.text: Schedules of reinforcement are an important component of the learning process. When and how often we reinforce behavior can have a dramatic impact on the strength and rate of the response. Identify the type of reinforcement wherein the response is reinforced only part of the time. Learned behaviors are acquired more slowly with partial reinforcement, but the response is more resistant to extinction.
options: Continuous Reinforcement
Impulsive Reinforcement
Partial Reinforcement
Positive Reinforcement
Regressive Reinforcement

quiz.text: Kurt Lewin’s Three Stages model or the Planned Approach to Organizational Change is one of the cornerstone models which is relevant in the present scenario. Lewin, a social scientist, and a physicist, during early 1950s propounded a simple framework for understanding the process of organizational change known as the Three-Stage Theory, which he referred as Unfreeze, ____________ "X"_________ and _______"Y"__________. Identify X and Y from the following options
options: Desertion and revolve
Direction and implement
Planning and organising
Change and Refreeze
None of the above

quiz.text: The McKinsey 7 S model refers to the seven key interrelated or integrated elements of an organization which are subdivided into hard and soft elements, The Hard elements are within the direct control of the management as it can be easily defined and identified. The following elements are the hard elements in an organization and The Soft elements are less tangible and are difficult to be defined and identified as such elements are more governed by the culture.  Which of the following is not an example of hard element as per 7-S model
options: Strategy
Structure
Systems
Shared Value
None of the above

quiz.text: The Legal Entity Identifier (LEI) code is conceived as a key measure to improve the quality and accuracy of financial data systems for better risk management post the Global Financial Crisis. LEI is a ____-digit unique code to identify parties to financial transactions worldwide. These directions are issued under Section 21 and Section 35(A) of the Banking Regulation Act, 1949
options: 10
15
20
8
25

quiz.text: Read the following statements and then select the right code  Statement A - As per Basel I norms the minimum capital ratio should be 8%. India RBI recommends it to be 9%. So, any bank in India having capital ratio of less than 9% Statement B - Basel Norm 2 has 3 pillars  Statement C - It would be RBI who will decide whether CCCB needs to be maintained and if yes then how much with in a range of 0-1.5%.
options: Only Statement A is correct
Only Statement B is correct
Only Statement C is correct
Only Statement A and B are correct
None of the above

quiz.text: RBI recently launched its Medium-term Strategy Framework for the period _________"Z"______ , called ‘Utkarsh 2.0’. Utkarsh 2.0 harnesses the strengths of Utkarsh 2022 by retaining the ______"Y"_________ Vision statements as well as Core Purpose, Values, and Mission statement. The revised structure consists of three layers, viz., Visions, Strategies and Milestones which will assist in the focused monitoring.Identify "Z" from the following options
options: 2023-2026
2023-2035
2023-2028
2023-2027
2023-2025

quiz.text: RBI recently launched its Medium-term Strategy Framework for the period _________"Z"______ , called ‘Utkarsh 2.0’. Utkarsh 2.0 harnesses the strengths of Utkarsh 2022 by retaining the ______"Y"_________ Vision statements as well as Core Purpose, Values, and Mission statement. The revised structure consists of three layers, viz., Visions, Strategies and Milestones which will assist in the focused monitoring.Identify "Y" from the following options
options: 8
7
6
5
4

quiz.text: RBI recently released the Annual Report of the Ombudsman Schemes for the period April, 2021 – March, 2022.The report covers the activities under the erstwhile Ombudsman Schemes i.e., Banking Ombudsman Scheme, 2006 (BOS), the Ombudsman Scheme for Non-Banking Financial Companies, 2018 (OSNBFC), and the Ombudsman Scheme for Digital Transactions, 2019 (OSDT) upto November 11, 2021, along with the activities under RB-IOS, 2021 since November 12, 2021Complaints relating to the digital modes of payment and transactions were the highest in number, constituting __________ per cent of the total complaints received during the year
options: 40%
50%
42%
52%
62%

quiz.text: The 15th Finance Commission (Chair: Mr N. K. Singh) was required to submit two reports. The first report, consisting of recommendations for the financial year 2020-21, was tabled in Parliament on February 1, 2020. The final report with recommendations for the 2021-26 period will be submitted by October 30, 2020. The 15th Finance Commission proposed recommendations for both vertical and horizontal devolution. In the same regard, the commission recommended for _____________ of the divisible pool to be devolved to the States in the year 2020-21.
options: 40%
41%
42%
45.22%
40.66%

quiz.text: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) will issue periodic scores to assess the performance of the digital payments industry on key operating parameters such as rural penetration and innovation in existing modes and channels. Called the Digital Payments Index (DPI), the ‘composite’ scoring system will allow both consumers and stakeholders to better gauge local area developments in infrastructure, access, demographic and acceptance related growth with reference to broader domestic and global standards in digital payments. “Digital payments in India have been growing rapidly. The Reserve Bank shall construct and periodically publish a composite DPI to capture the extent of digitisation of payments effectively,” RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said on Thursday. The DPI would be based on multiple parameters and reflect the penetration and deepening of various digital payment modes, said Governor Das. The banking regulator will make the index available in the public domain from July 2020. Based on the passage answer the following questions. The Reserve Bank of India in 2018 had constructed a composite Digital Payments Index (DPI) to capture the extent of digitisation of payments across the country. Which of the following parameter has the highest weightage in Digital payments index?
options: Payment Enabler
Payment Infrastructure – Demand-side factors,
Payment Infrastructure – Supply-side factors,
Payment Performance
Consumer Centricity

quiz.text: Leadership is the art of motivating a group of people to act toward achieving a common goal. In a business setting, this can mean directing workers and colleagues with a strategy to meet the company's needs. Leadership captures the essentials of being able and prepared to inspire others. Effective leadership is based upon ideas—both original and borrowed—that are effectively communicated to others in a way that engages them enough to act as the leader wants them to act. A leader inspires others to act while simultaneously directing the way that they act. They must be personable enough for others to follow their orders, and they must have the critical thinking skills to know the best way to use the resources at an organization's disposal. The Blake-Mouton Managerial Grid is a system that can be used to group like leaders into categories based on the methods that they use. This can be used to identify a manager's existing leadership style and provide a training path to the ideal leadership style required. The matrix analyses a manager’s style of leadership by the consideration of two dimensions. The managers concern for production (or the task) such as work efficiency or volume of output. The managers concern for people (or relationships) such as satisfying personal relations and establishing trust. According to Blake-Mouton Managerial Grid, identify the type of manager who fails in the terms of the task and also fails in the satisfying personal relations and establishing trust.
options: Country Club Manager
Task Manager
Status Quo Manager
Indifferent Manager
None of the above

quiz.text: Leadership is the art of motivating a group of people to act toward achieving a common goal. In a business setting, this can mean directing workers and colleagues with a strategy to meet the company's needs. Leadership captures the essentials of being able and prepared to inspire others. Effective leadership is based upon ideas—both original and borrowed—that are effectively communicated to others in a way that engages them enough to act as the leader wants them to act. A leader inspires others to act while simultaneously directing the way that they act. They must be personable enough for others to follow their orders, and they must have the critical thinking skills to know the best way to use the resources at an organization's disposal. The Blake-Mouton Managerial Grid is a system that can be used to group like leaders into categories based on the methods that they use. This can be used to identify a manager's existing leadership style and provide a training path to the ideal leadership style required. The matrix analyses a manager’s style of leadership by the consideration of two dimensions. The managers concern for production (or the task) such as work efficiency or volume of output. The managers concern for people (or relationships) such as satisfying personal relations and establishing trust. According to Blake-Mouton Managerial Grid, identify the type of manager who is able to successfully satisfy the needs of the organization as a whole with the needs of the individual employees involved
options: Status Quo Manager
Indifferent Manager
Team Manager
Task Manager
None of the above

quiz.text: Leadership is the art of motivating a group of people to act toward achieving a common goal. In a business setting, this can mean directing workers and colleagues with a strategy to meet the company's needs. Leadership captures the essentials of being able and prepared to inspire others. Effective leadership is based upon ideas—both original and borrowed—that are effectively communicated to others in a way that engages them enough to act as the leader wants them to act. A leader inspires others to act while simultaneously directing the way that they act. They must be personable enough for others to follow their orders, and they must have the critical thinking skills to know the best way to use the resources at an organization's disposal. The Blake-Mouton Managerial Grid is a system that can be used to group like leaders into categories based on the methods that they use. This can be used to identify a manager's existing leadership style and provide a training path to the ideal leadership style required. The matrix analyses a manager’s style of leadership by the consideration of two dimensions. The managers concern for production (or the task) such as work efficiency or volume of output. The managers concern for people (or relationships) such as satisfying personal relations and establishing trust. According to Blake-Mouton Managerial Grid, a Country Club Manager has following features, except
options: Manager has high concern to satisfy relationships, often at the expense of achieving the task.
Sub-ordinates are encouraged, supported and their needs are satisfied
Manager is considered a big brother and social relationships are given more importance.
A Country Club Manager follows accommodating style of leadership
All of the above are features of Country club manager

quiz.text: Leadership is the art of motivating a group of people to act toward achieving a common goal. In a business setting, this can mean directing workers and colleagues with a strategy to meet the company's needs. Leadership captures the essentials of being able and prepared to inspire others. Effective leadership is based upon ideas—both original and borrowed—that are effectively communicated to others in a way that engages them enough to act as the leader wants them to act. A leader inspires others to act while simultaneously directing the way that they act. They must be personable enough for others to follow their orders, and they must have the critical thinking skills to know the best way to use the resources at an organization's disposal. The Blake-Mouton Managerial Grid is a system that can be used to group like leaders into categories based on the methods that they use. This can be used to identify a manager's existing leadership style and provide a training path to the ideal leadership style required. The matrix analyses a manager’s style of leadership by the consideration of two dimensions. The managers concern for production (or the task) such as work efficiency or volume of output. The managers concern for people (or relationships) such as satisfying personal relations and establishing trust. According to Blake-Mouton Managerial Grid, what will be the score on X-axis and Y-axis for a manager who opts for Status Quo leadership style.
options: X-axis = 0 and Y axis = 1
X-axis = 10 and Y axis = 1
X-axis = 1 and Y axis = 10
X-axis = 5 and Y axis = 5
X-axis = 9 and Y axis = 0

quiz.text: Ram and Sham are working in a company called Raymond which manufactures Bedsheets. Polymer is used in manufacturing those bedsheets. Sham does the Profit and loss analysis and decides on from where to source the Polymer to maximize the profit. Ram makes sure that polymer is received on time and is used with care while manufacturing bedsheets to avoid Wastage. Which is most likely to be true for Ram and Sham?
options: Ram is working at administrative Layer while Sham at Managerial layer
Sham is working at administrative Layer while Ram at Managerial layer
Both Ram and Sham are working at administrative Layer
Both Ram and Sham are working at Managerial Layer
None of the above

quiz.text: Read the following statements and then select the right code  Statement A - The concept of Span of Control was given Sir Fedrick Taylor  Statement B - If the work to be performed is of routine nature, then span of control will be large Statement C - If manager delegates more and clear authority then much of his time will be saved which can be used for supervision. In this case span of control may be small
options: Only Statement A is correct
Only Statement B is correct
Only Statement C is correct
Only Statement B and C are correct
None of the above

quiz.text: Read the passage carefully and answer the following question which may require some additional information not given in the passage. Karen Horney, together with fellow psychoanalyst Adler formed the Neo Freudian Discipline. While Horney acknowledged and agreed with Freud on many issues, she was also critical of him on several key beliefs. Freud’s notion of Oedipal Complex and Penis Envy was subject to criticism by Horney, claiming that the clinging to one parent and jealousy of the other was simply the result of anxiety, caused by a disturbance in the parent-child relationship. Despite these variances with the prevalent Freudian view, Horney strove to reformulate Freudian thought, presenting a holistic and humanitarian view of the individual psyche which placed much emphasis on cultural and social differences worldwide. Karen Horney was undoubtedly a great influence on numerous self-psychologists, humanists, cognitive therapists, psychoanalysts, feminists, and existentialists. As a theorist, leader, teacher, and therapist, Horney made numerous contributions that have been highly significant in shaping and advancing psychological thought. The major negative comment that has been made about Horney’s theory is that her theory is limited to the neurotic aspect of personality. Besides leaving out psychotics and other problems, she leaves out the truly healthy person. Nevertheless, since she does put neurosis and health on a single continuum, she does speak to the neurotic in all of us. The Electra Complex, a concept formulated by Sigmund Freud, can be observed in _____________?
options: Male children
Male Adults
Female Children
Female Adults
Parents

quiz.text: Read the following statement and then select the right code Statement 1 - Autocratic model can be used when Employees are unskilled, inexperienced and submissiveStatement 2 - Autocratic model can be used when Employees have strong lower order needs to satisfy.Statement 3 - Autocratic model can be used when there is no urgency to make decisions
options: Only Statement 2 is incorrect
Only Statement 1 is incorrect
Only Statement 3 is incorrect
Only Statement 1 and 2 are incorrect
Only Statement 1 and 3 are incorrect

quiz.text: The Banking Regulation Act, 1949 empowers the Reserve Bank of India to inspect and supervise commercial banks. These powers are exercised through on-site inspection and off site surveillance. Financial regulation and supervision are the two important functions of the RBI. Regulation is just stipulating rules in accordance with the laws framed by the government for the effective control over the financial system. There is the Banking Regulation Act to regulate banks. Supervision is different from regulation. Here, the RBI goes to the headquarter of the bank to check whether the bank is complying with the rules and regulations. Till 1993, regulatory as well as supervisory functions over commercial banks were performed by the Department of Banking Operations and Development (DBOD). Subsequently, a new Department of Banking Supervision (DBS) was set up to take over the supervisory functions relating to the commercial banks from DBOD. For dedicated and integrated supervision over all credit institutions, i.e., banks, development financial institutions and non-banking financial companies, the Board for Financial Supervision (BFS) was set up in __________"X"__________ under the aegis of the Reserve Bank of India. For focused attention in the area of supervision over non-banking finance companies, Department of Supervision was further bifurcated in August 1997 into Department of Banking Supervision (DBS) and Department of Non-Banking Supervision (DNBS). These Departments now look after supervision over commercial banks & development financial institutions and non-banking financial companies, respectively. Both these departments now function under the direction of the Board for Financial Supervision (BFS). Identify X from the following options
options: 1995
1994
1996
1998
2000

quiz.text: The Banking Regulation Act, 1949 empowers the Reserve Bank of India to inspect and supervise commercial banks. These powers are exercised through on-site inspection and off site surveillance. Financial regulation and supervision are the two important functions of the RBI. Regulation is just stipulating rules in accordance with the laws framed by the government for the effective control over the financial system. There is the Banking Regulation Act to regulate banks. Supervision is different from regulation. Here, the RBI goes to the headquarter of the bank to check whether the bank is complying with the rules and regulations. Till 1993, regulatory as well as supervisory functions over commercial banks were performed by the Department of Banking Operations and Development (DBOD). Subsequently, a new Department of Banking Supervision (DBS) was set up to take over the supervisory functions relating to the commercial banks from DBOD. For dedicated and integrated supervision over all credit institutions, i.e., banks, development financial institutions and non-banking financial companies, the Board for Financial Supervision (BFS) was set up in __________"X"__________ under the aegis of the Reserve Bank of India. For focused attention in the area of supervision over non-banking finance companies, Department of Supervision was further bifurcated in August 1997 into Department of Banking Supervision (DBS) and Department of Non-Banking Supervision (DNBS). These Departments now look after supervision over commercial banks & development financial institutions and non-banking financial companies, respectively. Both these departments now function under the direction of the Board for Financial Supervision (BFS). Who among the following act as the chairman of the Board of Financial Supervision (BFS)
options: Finance Minister
Any of the 4 deputy Governors
A separate chairman is appointed by the Government of India
A separate chairman is appointed by the central board of RBI
Governor of RBI

quiz.text: The Banking Regulation Act, 1949 empowers the Reserve Bank of India to inspect and supervise commercial banks. These powers are exercised through on-site inspection and off site surveillance. Financial regulation and supervision are the two important functions of the RBI. Regulation is just stipulating rules in accordance with the laws framed by the government for the effective control over the financial system. There is the Banking Regulation Act to regulate banks. 2 years
3 years
4 years
5 years

quiz.text: Based on the following data, calculate the purchases made for Raman enterprises. Opening Inventory: ₹4,20,000 Closing Inventory: ₹2,20,000 Cost of Goods Sold (COGS): ₹5,00,000
options: ₹2,00,000
₹3,00,000
₹4,00,000
₹5,00,000

quiz.text: Recently (July 2023), which of the following have collaborated to launch a FinTech accelerator for early-stage Indian start-ups called ‘inFINity’?
options: PayU
Amazon Web Services
Chiratae Ventures
1 and 3
1, 2 and 3

options: Axis Bank
HDFC Bank
Bank of Baroda
State Bank of India

options: Indian Banks’ Association (IBA)

quiz.text: Recently (July 2023), the boards of HDFC and HDFC Bank have approved the merger between the two institutions. The merger has made HDFC Bank, the world's _________-biggest bank by market value
options: eighth
second
tenth
fourth
sixth

quiz.text: As per the recent (June) guidelines of the RBI, TReDS platform operators shall now be permitted to undertake settlement of all FUs – financed / discounted or otherwise – using the NACH mechanism used for TReDS. What does C stand for in the NACH?Which of the above statements is correct?
options: Cleaning
Clearing
Closing
Collective
Collaborative

quiz.text: Recently (In June), Financial Benchmarks India Private Limited (FBIL) has updated its list of ‘significant benchmarks’, which of the following is not administered by the FBIL?
options: Overnight Mumbai Interbank Outright Rate (MIBOR)
USD/INR Reference Rate
Secured Overnight Financing Rate (SOFR)
Treasury Bill Rates

quiz.text: According to the recently (In June) released, framework for Compromise Settlements and Technical Write-offs by the RBI, the cooling period in respect of exposures other than farm credit exposures shall be subject to a floor of __________.
options: 6 months
12 months
9 months
18 months
24 months

options: 61.9%
50%
